text: Chefchaouen or Chaouen (Berber: ⵛⴰⵡⴻⵏ/ⵛⴼⵛⴰⵡⴻⵏ, Arabic: شفشاون/الشاون) is a small important historical and tourist city in the north of Maghreb. Chefchaouen is located in the Rif Mountains of northwestern Morocco.Tom Masters, Europe on a Shoestring (Oakland, CA: Lonely Planet, 2009), p. 815 Many Moriscos and Jews settled in this city after the Spanish Reconquista in the Late Middle Ages. The city is famous for its blue houses and alleys. == Gallery == File:Old medina of morocco.jpg| File:Chaouen2 055.jpg| File:Chef Chaouen Maroc.JPG| File:Chefchaouen, Morocco (5409550885) (4).jpg| File:Chefchauen, tipically blue-rinsed houses.jpg| File:La medina de chefchaouen.jpg| Image:Iglesia Chefchaouen.jpg| File:Door in Chefchaouen.jpg|Doors == Related pages == *Morocco *Essaouira *Fes == References == == Other websites == *Chaouen Info - Information about the city and province of Chefchaouen Category:Cities in Morocco Category:Tourism
title: Chefchaouen
